snippet: Legal experts say individual players — and potentially teams — could be held legally responsible for opponents’ injuries in cases involving a reckless disregard for safety.
abstract: New Orleans Saints will almost certainly receive fines, suspensions and/or the loss of draft picks because of the bounty system administered by the former defensive coordinator Gregg Williams that encouraged Saints players to injure opponents; legal experts say individual players--and potentially teams--could be held legally responsible for opponents' injuries in cases involving a reckless disregard for safety.
lead_paragraph: Legal experts say individual players — and potentially teams — could be held legally responsible for opponents’ injuries in cases involving a reckless disregard for safety.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Bounties Could Lead to Lawsuits
headline.main: Teams Could Be Held Liable for Injuries Traced to Bounties
headline.print_headline: Teams Could Be Held Liable for Injuries Traced to Bounties
